content:
Top sellers and manufacturers

Find used machinery sales on TradeMachines

Through its search engine for used machinery TradeMachines brings together sellers and buyers effectively. Buyers do not need to search for used machines on multiple seller websites anymore since TradeMachines combines the offers of renowned industrial auctioneers and used machinery traders, thus presenting a comprehensive market overview. Used machines are a worthwhile alternative to buying expensive new machines.

Machine experts all over the world drink their morning coffee while browsing through TradeMachines and get informed about the current offers of the second hand machinery market. We offer buyers an overview of used industrial equipment available on the market with absolute transparency as a goal. The marketplace is designed to offer used machinery seekers with options to choose on equipment auctions by location, auction houses and machinery type. TradeMachines aims to provide you with a search engine that could maximize your opportunities to find the best bargains possible online from top industrial equipment sellers worldwide.

Heavy equipment auctions

With heavy equipment auctions taking place all over the world, it is not an easy task to find the offers you are looking for from various source. TradeMachines is the search engine for used machines which enables machinery-seekers to find the offers and sales they are searching. Next to heavy equipment auctions the offer also includes direct sales from international used machinery traders. The combined offer of industrial machinery auctions and and used machinery sales creates the most comprehensive market overview worldwide. By offering a way to find the equipment auction that has what you need - you save time, money, and energy. There are two types of auctions typically listed on our marketplace website: liquidation auctions and industrial auctions. Liquidation or Insolvency auctions and asset auctions include second hand machinery from seized company assets. These auctions include bank owned property being sold to recoup losses from a company. Heavy equipment auctions are a mixture of sellers from private owners to companies. Businesses that no longer need the equipment need to make sales in order to recoup money from their old or used machinery.

Industrial auctions and used heavy equipment

TradeMachines understands how difficult it is to trust in used machinery. We work with trustful industrial auctioneers and renowned machinery traders to ensure you receive the best connection between the two. Industrial auctions are a popular possibility to find great bargains when it comes to used machinery. In these industrial auctions potential buyers find used equipment of companies who became insolvent or who decided to get rid of a selection of their machines. But industrial auctions are not the only way how to find the right used machines for cheap prices. Machinery traders list their offers on TradeMachines as well. As a result of the extensive offer of used machines, it is much easier and less time consuming to the find right offer.

By using different features like the auction calendar of TradeMachines, you can find industrial auctions worldwide.

Top brands for industrial trucks

Top sellers for industrial trucks

Trademachines - largest inventory of used forklifts 

Trademachines offers a wide selection of forklift auctions and direct sales available on the market. You will find here numerous forklift trucks on sale at competitive prices. Use filters on our website - you can specify region (so you can find auctions near you), price range, manufacturer, year of make or seller. Thanks to the filters you will find a vehicle which is best-suited for your needs lowering your investment costs.

The world of forklifts: new advanced search functions

The forklift industry is highly segmented between energy type, environments, usage etc… We continuously improve our product to make your searches of forklifts easier. Use our new advanced search functions to find exactly the truck you are looking for in just a few seconds.  

What should I know before buying a forklift on an auction?

A forklift auction is a great way of saving money on expensive machinery. Purchase of a used but well maintained forklift is a good and cost effective solution for you and your company. Before buying the truck, there are a few things you should check: 

  • Average price of a model you want to bid for
  • The overall condition of the vehicle
  • Cost of transportation 
  • Is there a warranty? 
  • Future maintenance costs

What are the different types of forklifts?

There are many types of forklift trucks designed for different applications, from being ideal in the outdoors to being optimised for heavy loads. Read more about rough terrain forklifts, telescopic forklifts, tow tractors or hand operated pallet trucks. 

Forklift trucks can also be powered in a number of ways. Electric forklifts are environmentally friendly and produce no emissions. Diesel forklifts are ideal for outdoor use, when those powered by LPG are quite popular thanks to their competitive prices.  

Forklifts can also differ from one another in accessories, attachments or extensions which will increase the versatility, load capacity and overall performance of the equipment. 

What are the best forklift manufacturers?

The world’s largest forklift manufacturer is Toyota. However, there are many more widely acclaimed manufacturers producing reliable and robust machinery. Among them there are: JCB, Jungheinrich, KOMATSU, Nissan, JLG, Linde, Mitsubishi, Kalmar or Crown.

If you ever bought or sold any pieces of used machinery then chances are that you struggled to find a fair price. If your price is too high in comparison to what other traders or auctioneers are offering, you will scare the clientele away. However If the price is too low it might look like a scam. Prices measure the estimated value of a good, so you want to get it right!

Machine Price Checker: data-driven valuation tool

In our mission to make the used machinery market more transparent, our machine price checker is a crucial tool. International data points such as prices and machine attributes from over 20 million machines have been collected over the last 10 years, making our tool a reliable source or information. As a result, we now have a price estimation available for more than 35,000 machines.

Finding the optimal & fair price using data-driven reasoning is a huge asset whether you are a buyer or a seller of used machinery. The goal of our tool is to help you assess faster and better the value of the second hand equipment you want to to sell or buy. 

How does our price evaluation tool work?

The price checker is really intuitive to use: simply insert the name of the manufacturer and the model in the appropriate field, right at the top of the page. You will instantly have an average price displayed on the website. 

Furthermore, we will share with you some insights regarding the item and which factors were taken into consideration for the evaluation: the range of year of make, the location and the number of items the estimation was based upon.

If you want to have a further look at our offers for the desired item, you're welcome to check our catalog, simply displayed below the machinery price estimation.

How to use the price estimation tool for used machinery?

The machine price checker has to be used in conjunction with detailed researches. It gives you a good starting point to find the optimal selling price, however a number of other factors are not taken into account such as the condition for example. 

Always research further by browsing similar offers on our search engine to evaluate how much you are willing to invest in your used machines. 

Finding the right price for a used piece of machinery requires a considerable amount of experience in the business, not to mention the understanding of how a particular machine works and which factors make its value decrease. Our technology does not replace the valuation made by experts in the field.

If you want to know more about the factors influencing the price of a machine, read our pricing guide.
